comment: She is not always clear.  Difficult to make an A.  What you put in this class is what you get.  I wouldn't say she teaches... Just practice your speech and make sure you meet her requirements.  Tough grader.  Don't count on her outside of class for any questions.  Hardly any homework.  No quizzes only midterm and final.  Don't miss a speech!!!!!!

She expects you to be pretty darn good right off the bat with giving a speech and grades harshly, counting off points for every small thing. Uses power points to cover the information in the book. Midterm and final were online so the book can be used. She sets deadlines for topics and if you miss them, you fail the speech.
Awful at communication in person and email.  Extremely difficult to earn A and Hard to earn a B.  What you put in is what you get.

I would never recommend taking her class for anything EVER. She grades super strict as if we're all professional public speakers. In my class the first speech we had to give  the class average was a 59. She doesn't understanding at all that you have other classes that are supposed to harder and more important than hers. DON'T TAKE HER!!!

She's horrible. An awful excuse for a teacher. I had two aunts pass away during my speech times and couldn't do my speech. I showed her the obituaries and funeral programs and still didn't get to make anything up. I swear I would learn more from a 1st grader about public speaking than her. We never used the book, we had our midterm on the 2nd week.

Literally the hardest teacher I have ever had. She grades your presentations like you are a professional. The only way you can make an A is to be on her speech team. She only cares for them and doesn't give a crap about her students. I ask her questions, she doesn't give an answer. She expects you to know the answer.

She is a harsh grader, but if you follow her instructions and put in just some effort you can probably get an A or B. I thought she was an interesting and funny person that keeps the class fairly engaged, which is pretty good for just going off of powerpoints. She takes attendance in the beginning of each class.

Her lectures are useless - goes through presentations with the speed of lightning. You ask a questions, she turns it against you. Her instructions about speeches are very confusing. I went through 3 speeches and I am still not sure what she wanted exactly. She grades very harshly. Do yourself a favor and take the class with another instructor.

She has great knowledge of the subject matter and i think that's kinda of making her proud. she's very disrespectful to students and grades her speeches harshly. I had an A in the course but it took a lot of work. she makes her class interesting and interactive. Good luck with her

She grades harshly. She has an attitude all the time and is not willing to go out of her way to help students. Its very easy to fail the class. Maybe if you buy her a carton of cigarettes you can pass the course.

You will get a good grade if you show up to class and participate. Also if you do all the speech's you are assigned you can not fail. Everyone complains about her and I know why but it's just public speaking and she takes her job seriously so take the class seriously.

Avoid at ALL costs, even if it means your entire schedule gets re-arranged. If you're brazen enough to stick with it, expect to be graded extraordinarily harshly, get points docked for insignificant little things, and be guided by an instructor that flies through presentations and is very difficult to reason with. Avoid at all costs.
do not take her for ANY class. avoid her at all costs...
Tough teacher but if you show interest and work on your speech prior to giving you will do fine.  If you procrastinate your grade will reflect it. Exams are online and you can use your book.

Very tough professor, but if you show to her that you care about your grade (do all extra credit, take notes in class, answer questions in class), it will be reflected in your speech scores.  You will have to work hard to get an A in this class.

The good: Entertaining lecturer. | The bad: Kicks students out of the classroom for dumb reasons (which results in an absence for the day). Very harsh grading habits. Responds very rudely to some questions/requests. Cares much more about her speech team than any of her other students.

Not that great of a teacher. Cares more about her debate team, is late about getting grades back on speeches, and expects all students to be perfect on speeches. Grading is horrible. You lose 10% of your speech grade for every 5 seconds you are off from the time limit. 3 major speeches. 9 quizzes.

Do not take this professor, ever. All the other negative comments are 100% true. She grades way to harshly for how incredibly unhelpful and unprofessional she acts during and outside of class. She will try to kick you out of the classroom for stupid little things. If you feel like you have to take her to graduate, don't, wait a semester...

Avoid! Grades harshly and cares more about her speech team then she does for the students paying her salary. To state it simply, rude, unhelpful, and a hypocrite. Grades all students as if they are on her speech team.

Wouldn't recommend for a professor(.)I'm a sophomore @ SPSU,make good grades,& am very amiable.-She seems to put on a facade btwn acting hype in class about the subject but then going APECRAZY when you ask for help or make a pin-drop mistake.   She doesn't go out of HER way 4 student assists. Comes off as LAZY. See other reviews...& COMMprofessors

Not a very good teacher. She did not have proper examples ready during class. went hysterical at a student for using a translator. She's nice 1 second and crazy the next. very arrogant. poor hand writing. relies on the book too much.

She is Horrible. do not take her, will make you fail the class even when you can see you improve in your public speaking skills. i'm pretty sure nobody ever had an A in that class. Very boring and arrogant and she just SUCKS

AVOID at all costs!!!!!! I agree with all the other comments...lazy and really annoying.  She is will fail you if aren't a great public speaker.  Her priorities go in the order of: herself, public speaking team,.....then finally the students in her class trying to pass!!!!!
Two Words: Lazy and Arrogant.  These are the two you can't have in a professor.

DO NOT TAKE HER!! By far the laziest and dumbest teacher at SPSU.  She is extremely arrogant and thinks she is better than the students.  You will recieve your first speech grade two weeks before school ends!! Her lecutres are pointless and really stupid.

AVOID at all costs! This is the worst teacher I have ever had. She teaches this class as if it were a graduate-level class. She is also a speech teacher, so she requires speeches--two individual and a group project that spanned the entire semester and consisted of three presentations (worst class experience I?ve had at school so far).
